sentences.en: a capitation fee for each pupil
sentences.cn: 摊派到每个小学生头上的收费

sentences.en: A higher fee does not necessarily mean a better course.
sentences.cn: 收费更高并不意味着课程就一定更好。

sentences.en: An initial fee is payable to the franchiser.
sentences.cn: 应该付给经销商一笔先期费用.

sentences.en: Customers who overdraw their accounts will be charged a fee.
sentences.cn: 透支的存户须付手续费。

sentences.en: Does the bank charge a fee for setting up the account?
sentences.cn: 在这家银行开立账户要收费吗？

sentences.en: He charged a relatively modest fee.
He finally corrected his misstatement and offered to reduce the fee.
sentences.cn: 他终于纠正了自己的错误说法，提出要减少费用。

sentences.en: He paid his licence fee, and walked out with a brand-new driving licence.
sentences.cn: 他付了驾照费用，拿着一张全新的驾照走出来。

sentences.en: He responded positively and accepted the fee of £1,000 I had offered.
sentences.cn: 他作出了肯定的答复，并接受了我给的1，000英镑的费用。

sentences.en: He threatens to dock her fee.
sentences.cn: 他威胁要扣掉她的服务费。

sentences.en: Sellers pay a fixed commission fee.
sentences.cn: 卖方支付固定的服务费。

sentences.en: The boss of the ballroom excused them the fee.
The full fee is payable on enrollment.
sentences.cn: 所有费用在注冊时缴付.

sentences.en: They charge a£66.10 fee for reconnecting cut-off customers.
sentences.cn: 他们向申请重新接通服务的用户收取66.10英镑的费用。

sentences.en: Three considerations argue against increasing fee.
sentences.cn: 三种理由反对增加费用.

sentences.en: You can use the gym and pool for a fee of £35 a month.
sentences.cn: 月付35英镑，即可使用健身房和游泳池。

phrases.tran_cn: (律 史)（因履行封建义务而）获封（土地），拥有（封地）
作为无条件和合法所有的
注册费，登记费；挂号费；更名费

trans.tran_en: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work
